args.natural_language_statement: Suppose f'(x) > 0 on (a,b). Prove f is strictly increasing on (a,b), and let g be its inverse function. Prove g is differentiable and g'(f(x)) = 1 / f'(x) for a<x<b. Translate into Lean4 (import Mathlib at top and end the Lean4 statement with := by sorry).

history.content: Suppose f'(x)>0 in (a,b). Prove that f is strictly increasing in (a,b), and let g be its inverse function. Prove that g is differentiable, and that g'(f(x))=1/f'(x) (a<x<b). Save it to Rudin_exercise_5_2.lean

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Rudin exercise: Suppose f'(x)>0 on (a,b). Prove f is strictly increasing on (a,b), and
let g be its inverse function. Prove g is differentiable and g'(f(x)) = 1 / f'(x) for a<x<b. -/
theorem Rudin_exercise_5_2 {f : â„ â†’ â„} {a b : â„} (hab : a < b)
  (h_deriv : âˆ€ x âˆˆ Ioo a b, HasDerivAt f (deriv f x) x)
  (h_pos : âˆ€ x âˆˆ Ioo a b, 0 < deriv f x) :
  StrictMonoOn f (Ioo a b) âˆ§
  let g := fun y => Function.invFunOn f (Ioo a b) y in
  (âˆ€ x âˆˆ Ioo a b, HasDerivAt g (1 / deriv f x) (f x)) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Rudin exercise: Suppose f'(x)>0 on (a,b). Prove f is strictly increasing on (a,b), and
let g be its inverse function. Prove g is differentiable and g'(f(x)) = 1 / f'(x) for a<x<b. -/
theorem Rudin_exercise_5_2 {f : â„ â†’ â„} {a b : â„} (hab : a < b)
  (h_deriv : âˆ€ x âˆˆ Ioo a b, HasDerivAt f (deriv f x) x)
  (h_pos : âˆ€ x âˆˆ Ioo a b, 0 < deriv f x) :
  StrictMonoOn f (Ioo a b) âˆ§
  (âˆ€ x âˆˆ Ioo a b, HasDerivAt (Function.invFunOn f (Ioo a b)) (1 / deriv f x) (f x)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Rudin exercise: Suppose f'(x)>0 on (a,b). Prove f is strictly increasing on (a,b), and
let g be its inverse function. Prove g is differentiable and g'(f(x)) = 1 / f'(x) for a<x<b. -/
theorem Rudin_exercise_5_2 {f : â„ â†’ â„} {a b : â„} (hab : a < b)
  (h_deriv : âˆ€ x âˆˆ Set.Ioo a b, HasDerivAt f (deriv f x) x)
  (h_pos : âˆ€ x âˆˆ Set.Ioo a b, 0 < deriv f x) :
  StrictMonoOn f (Set.Ioo a b) âˆ§
  (âˆ€ x âˆˆ Set.Ioo a b, HasDerivAt (Function.invFunOn f (Set.Ioo a b)) (1 / deriv f x) (f x)) := by sorry
